channel.title: Formula 1 news - Autosport
channel.description: Stay up to date with the latest Formula 1 news from Autosport.

item.title: Hungarian GP: Ferrari adds 'boomerang' wings to F1 bargeboards
item.description: Ferrari has become the latest Formula 1 team to incorporate boomerang-shaped wings into its bargeboard package, and has brought updated aerodynamic components to the Hungarian Grand Prix

item.title: "Completely wrong" Ferrari F1 unsafe release fine won't be repeated
item.description: Autosport can reveal that the FIA has agreed with Formula 1 teams that unsafe pitstop releases will be punished with time penalties rather than fines, following Ferrari's incident at Hockenheim

item.title: Ferrari doesn't have full fix for Leclerc Germany qualifying issue
item.description: The Ferrari Formula 1 team needs "a little bit more time" to completely fix the issue that struck Charles Leclerc in qualifying for last weekend's German Grand Prix

item.title: Catalan government approval moves Spanish GP closer to 2020 F1 deal
item.description: The Spanish Grand Prix is set to remain on the 2020 Formula 1 calendar after the Catalan government approved a plan for a one-year extension of the Barcelona circuit's contract

item.title: Penalties expected for Renault, McLaren for new F1 Spec C engine
item.description: The four drivers from the Renault and McLaren Formula 1 teams are set to take grid penalties at Spa and Monza when a new Spec C power unit is introduced

item.title: Racing Point adds extended F1 suspension upright bracket for Hungary
item.description: Racing Point has brought a new suspension upgrade to the Hungarian Grand Prix, becoming the latest Formula 1 team to add an extended upright bracket to the pushrod

item.title: Hulkenberg will carry F1 German GP "pain" for "little while longer"
item.description: Renault's Nico Hulkenberg says he will carry the "sting" and "pain" of his crash in Formula 1's German Grand Prix for a "little while longer"

item.title: Sergio Perez's deal with Racing Point F1 team set to be extended
item.description: Sergio Perez is set to extend his stay with the Racing Point Formula 1 team beyond the 2020 season, although he insists the deal is still being finalised

item.title: Steiner: Desperate move to drop a Haas F1 driver to end clashes
item.description: Haas Formula 1 team boss Gunther Steiner says dropping either Kevin Magnussen or Romain Grosjean in-season to stop them hitting each other would almost be a "desperate move"

item.title: Alfa Romeo F1 team will appeal post-German GP time penalty
item.description: Alfa Romeo has confirmed it is going ahead with an appeal against the penalties imposed on Kimi Raikkonen and Antonio Giovinazzi at the Formula 1 German Grand Prix

item.title: Video: How F1's 2021 ground effect differs from fearsome predecessor
item.description: A commitment to reintroducing ground effect aerodynamics was an eye-catching standout in Formula's 2021 proposals and is evocative of the championship's late '70s and early '80s era

item.title: Renault Formula 1 truck driver discharged from hospital
item.description: The Renault truck driver injured in a crash on the way to Hungarian Grand Prix has been flown home to recover and the Formula 1 team's preparations have been unaffected

item.title: Autosport Podcast: A Formula 1 nearly man's unusual career
item.description: Ahead of the 2000 season, Brazilian driver Max Wilson had a drive with the Minardi team and was looking forward to his first Formula 1 campaign

item.title: Red Bull: Hungarian GP win vs "mighty" slow-speed Mercedes difficult
item.description: Christian Horner says Red Bull knows it will be difficult to win this weekend's Hungarian Grand Prix given the Mercedes Formula 1 car's "mighty" performance in slow-speed corners

item.title: Mercedes won't intervene to keep German GP on F1 calendar again
item.description: Mercedes Formula 1 boss Toto Wolff says the manufacturer will not intervene to try to keep the German Grand Prix on the calendar for 2020
